image.altText: A Brisbane Lions AFL player celebrates a goal in the grand final.

props.synopsis: The Magpies lose one of the pillars of their defence, while Zac Bailey makes his presence felt up forward for the Lions in a tense AFL grand final at the MCG. Follow live.

title.children: Pies dealt major blow, Bailey kicks one of the great grand final goals

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: No shortage of highlights out there. We've seen some of the best goals you'll ever find in a grand final, with Zac Bailey in particular lighting things up in that Punt Rd forward pocket. But the stats say the Pies enjoyed the best of that term. Collingwood are leading clearances and contested ball, and have a sizable lead in the inside 50 count too. It looks as if the Pies are playing the more sustainable footy for now, but Brisbane are so dangerous going forward. A bit to like for both sides, way too early to call.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: QT: Magpies lead a fast-paced grand final by 10 points

children.content: No shortage of highlights out there. We've seen some of the best goals you'll ever find in a grand final, with Zac Bailey in particular lighting things up in that Punt Rd forward pocket.
But the stats say the Pies enjoyed the best of that term. Collingwood are leading clearances and contested ball, and have a sizable lead in the inside 50 count too.
It looks as if the Pies are playing the more sustainable footy for now, but Brisbane are so dangerous going forward. A bit to like for both sides, way too early to call.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: My goodness me, Zac Bailey! Bailey stuck the smother on Cox, followed up at ground level, kept the ball in on the line, shrugged a tackle, stepped inside another and then snapped from the pocket. Incredible. The Lions are in front, and they are working some serious forward 50 magic.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 5': Zac Bailey kicks one of the great grand final goals!

children.content: My goodness me, Zac Bailey! Bailey stuck the smother on Cox, followed up at ground level, kept the ball in on the line, shrugged a tackle, stepped inside another and then snapped from the pocket.
Incredible. The Lions are in front, and they are working some serious forward 50 magic.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The boy wonder! The prince who was promised! Collingwood's young superstar converts from directly in front to give the Pies a dream start.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 18': Nick Daicos kicks the first goal of the grand final!

children.content: The boy wonder! The prince who was promised! Collingwood's young superstar converts from directly in front to give the Pies a dream start.

image.altText: A Collingwood AFL player looks behind him as he carries the ball, while a Brisbane player pivots to try and close in.

props.synopsis: It's time for the AFL's biggest game of the year, as Collingwood and Brisbane meet in the grand final at the MCG. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: The AFL grand final has finally arrived — here's all you need to know

image.altText: ACT Education Directorate director-general Katy Haire in front of Campbell Primary School.

props.synopsis: The head of the ACT Education Directorate tells the territory's integrity commission she did not seek legal advice when she overruled a decision by a tender evaluation process but, in hindsight, she wishes she did.

title.children: Why this top public servant says she awarded a contract to a more expensive and lower scoring tenderer

image.altText: a large aboriginal flag flying above a large group of people at a city march

props.synopsis: As Australians prepare to deliver their answer to the referendum question on October 14, there is another question playing out between the two campaigns vying for your vote, writes Dana Morse.

title.children: When it comes to the Voice referendum, can love ever win in war?

image.altText: a group of people strolling outdoors in Sydney along a footpath as a woman pushes a pram and a man jogs

props.synopsis: This September will go down as the hottest and driest on record in parts of Australia. But after another hot weekend will come a significant drenching, explains ABC meteorologist Tom Saunders.

title.children: It's hot again — but a clash between Antarctica and the tropics is set to bring a drenching next week

image.altText: Elon Musk between the Twitter and X logos.

props.synopsis: Former Twitter executive Yoel Roth, who was responsible for policing misinformation on the platform, has warned Elon Musk's X is increasingly vulnerable to foreign governments and extremists trying to influence the Voice to Parliament referendum.

title.children: Voice to Parliament 'prime target' for foreign influence, former Twitter executive warns

image.altText: nsw police and paremedics attend to two fishermen whose boat was struck by a whale at la perouse in sydney

props.synopsis: A man has died and another has been taken to hospital after an early morning fatal collision with a whale at Sydney's Botany Bay.

title.children: Man dies after boat hits whale off NSW coast

image.altText: A three-way composite image shows Jacinda Ardern, Chris Hipkins and Christopher Luxon

props.synopsis: New Zealand Prime Minister Chris Hipkins is fighting for his party's survival as the country heads to the polls on October 14.

title.children: 'New Zealanders are thinking we're on the wrong track': The challenge confronting PM candidates

image.altText: The back of a policeman facing the felled tree with tape that says police line do not cross

props.synopsis: A man in his sixties has become the second person arrested in the investigation of the deliberate felling of a tree beside Hadrian's Wall in northern England.

title.children: Pub offers bar tab reward for information over Robin Hood tree loss

image.altText: A close up of a woman with blonde hair leaning on her fist as she sits at a table.

props.synopsis: Investigators looking into the poisoning of a woman on a pier unearthed a string of other crimes connected with "Am Cyanide". This is how Thailand's worst suspected serial killer was brought undone.

title.children: This woman could be Thailand's worst serial killer. Families of her alleged victims want the death penalty

image.altText: A 2004 press shot of The Killers

props.synopsis: Twenty years on, why do we all still make such a hot fuss over The Killers' urgent tale of paranoia and jealousy.

title.children: Mr. Brightside: The Killers' enduring hit that might live forever

image.altText: Child's face wearing a face mask and half obscured by darkness

props.synopsis: Most children recover fully after COVID in a similar way to other viruses. A small proportion experience prolonged symptoms including fatigue, post-exertional malaise, concentration difficulties and pain, writes Shidan Tosif.

title.children: What to do if you think your child has long COVID

image.altText: Two men wearing clothes from the early 200s smile and drink champagne.

props.synopsis: Netflix has shuttered its DVD delivery service, triggering co-founder Marc Randolph to revisit the near misses that characterised the company's early days of experimentation and risk-taking.

title.children: Netflix shutters the remnants of the largest publicly accessible film library in history

image.altText: Man and woman standing next to a gavel hitting a wooden block

props.synopsis: "Despite what people may think, lawyers in real life are generally very honest and try to act morally. Legal careers can be long and maintaining a good reputation is highly important."

title.children: Suits is now one of the most-watched shows on Netflix. But what do real-life lawyers think of it?

image.altText: A man standing in a photo studio with his leg resting on a box.

props.synopsis: Crispian Chan was eight when his family's Chinese restaurant was firebombed by a neo-Nazi group. As an adult, he set out to track their leader down.

title.children: My family was terrorised by a group of neo-Nazis. I decided to track down their leader

image.altText: a mug shot of a white man with a white beard

props.synopsis: Scott Graham Hall — charged alongside former US president Donald Trump and 17 others in the Georgia election interference case — becomes the first defendant in the case to accept a plea deal with prosecutors.

title.children: Defendant in Georgia election interference case accepts deal with prosecutors

image.altText: Danielle is running along a path through the bush with her two young kids. They're all laughing.

props.synopsis: Gaps in high-quality, comprehensive antenatal education are contributing to life-long injuries and birth trauma, maternity experts and parents say.

title.children: 'There's so much I wish I had known': Women speak out about inadequate preparation for giving birth

image.altText: A sea lion sits on a rock in the middle of Central Park.

props.synopsis: Almost 200 millimetres of rain falls in some parts of the most populous city in the US, enough to enable a sea lion at Central Park Zoo to swim briefly out of the confines of her pool enclosure.

title.children: Sea lion swims free from Central Park Zoo as New York hit by major flash flooding

image.altText: South Korean players place their hands on their hearts after winning gold at the Asian Games.

props.synopsis: In South Korea, the law exempts athletes, classical and traditional musicians, and ballet and other dancers from military service if they have obtained top prizes in certain competitions and are assessed to have enhanced national prestige.

title.children: South Korean eSports players secure military exemption after winning gold at Asian Games

image.altText: Busby Marou duo, Jeremy and Tom, sit next to each other

props.synopsis: While the musical duo has previously been apolitical, they say anxiety around the upcoming Voice to Parliament referendum has prompted them to speak out.

title.children: Busby Marou never talk about politics — but this subject is different

image.altText: Ronald Sackville and David Hurley look at the Disability Royal Commission final report

props.synopsis: The disability royal commission's report has been described by advocates as a turning point towards a fully inclusive and de-segregated Australia — but they warn the recommendations must be acted on.

title.children: Mixed emotions from disability community after final report handed down from royal commission

image.altText: Dianne Feinstein picks up her name plate in the Senate.

props.synopsis: Dianne Feinstein — a long-serving Democratic US senator, fierce opponent of former president Donald Trump and gun control advocate who spearheaded the first federal assault weapons ban — has died at the age of 90.

title.children: 'A role model': Dianne Feinstein, America's longest-serving female senator, dies at 90

image.altText: A couple with light brown hair stand in front of a brick building smiling at the camera while holding their one year old

props.synopsis: Leigh Miller expected farm work would fill his days after moving home but has found his skills as a physiotherapist in great demand.

title.children: Farmer's side hustle helps bridge gap in bush town's health care

image.altText: An aerial shot of a large truck driving away from a house on stilts with colourful tarps on the roof

props.synopsis: Owners of historic, flood-affected homes in Lismore say attempts to relocate their houses to safer land are being thwarted by bureaucracy, despite the promised government support.

title.children: Residents want to take 'beautiful, special' homes off the flood plain. The government has made that hard

image.altText: group of women in high-vis pose for a selfie through an instagram post cutout.

props.synopsis: Mining is a famously male-dominated industry, but a group of women on a remote site in WA's north say that is changing.

title.children: Looking up to see female leaders inspires mining industry 'minority'

image.altText: Potrait shot of Shakira.

props.synopsis: Pop star Shakira came to international prominence in the early 2000s with her breakthrough hit Whenever, Wherever. But more recently it's her tax troubles that are making headlines.

title.children: Shakira faces eight years' jail, accused of committing tax fraud in Spain

image.altText: Two cowboys in the outback standing over a campfire

props.synopsis: Scientists and environmentalists are given unique access to measure and report on how cattle giant Hewitt has been refining its production practices and land management with a greener focus.

title.children: The brothers behind Australia's biggest meat industry biodiversity study look to the future

image.altText: Jai Opetaia with his belts

props.synopsis: Jai Opetaia stunned the boxing world with a brave, bloody victory over Mairis Briedis last July. Now, 14 months down the line, he's back, putting his world titles on the line against the dangerous Englishman Jordan Thompson at Wembley.

title.children: His last fight resulted in him eating through a straw for months — now Jai Opetaia is back to defend his world titles
